oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The Ladies' Hermitage Association membership card
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Membership card for the Ladies' Hermitage Association, issued to Elise Croft. The card issues free admissions to the Hermitage, Tulip Grove, and Old Hermitage Church during the year 1980. Mrs. Joseph S. Reeves was the membership chairman.

In 1889, the Ladies’ Hermitage Association was founded when a women’s group, inspired by the Mount Vernon Ladies’ Association, saw a need to preserve President Andrew Jackson’s home, land, and tomb. The association worked to renovate and repair the house and grounds over time and to acquire Jackson’s possessions, and presently the home and property are still maintained by the association.
